name: yacht
description: Yacht is a self-hosted web UI for managing Docker containers and compose stacks. It offers app templates, logs, resource views, and update management, acting as a simpler alternative to Portainer for homelabs.
features: Container management: Start, stop, and restart Docker containers with a clean web interface instead of CLI commands.
Template library: Deploy popular applications quickly using pre-configured templates with sensible defaults.
Compose support: Manage multi-container applications defined in docker-compose files through the GUI.
Resource monitoring: View CPU, memory, and network usage for each container in real-time dashboards.
Log viewer: Access container logs directly in the browser with filtering and search capabilities.
Volume management: Create, attach, and manage Docker volumes for persistent data storage across containers.
Network configuration: Set up custom Docker networks and manage container connectivity through visual tools.
Update notifications: Receive alerts when newer container images are available for running applications.
Port mapping: Configure port forwards and expose container services with an intuitive interface.
Environment variables: Edit container environment variables without rebuilding or restarting from scratch.
Image management: Pull, remove, and inspect Docker images from registries through the web UI.
User authentication: Secure access with login credentials and role-based permissions for multi-user environments.
